      • setParameters

        public void setParameters(int baudRate,
                          int dataBits,
                          int stopBits,
                          int parity)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: UsbSerialPort_qcom
        Sets various serial port parameters.
        Specified by:
        setParameters in interface UsbSerialPort_qcom
        Parameters:
        baudRate - baud rate as an integer, for example 115200.
        dataBits - one of UsbSerialPort_qcom.DATABITS_5, UsbSerialPort_qcom.DATABITS_6, UsbSerialPort_qcom.DATABITS_7, or UsbSerialPort_qcom.DATABITS_8.
        stopBits - one of UsbSerialPort_qcom.STOPBITS_1, UsbSerialPort_qcom.STOPBITS_1_5, or UsbSerialPort_qcom.STOPBITS_2.
        parity - one of UsbSerialPort_qcom.PARITY_NONE, UsbSerialPort_qcom.PARITY_ODD, UsbSerialPort_qcom.PARITY_EVEN, UsbSerialPort_qcom.PARITY_MARK, or UsbSerialPort_qcom.PARITY_SPACE.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on error setting the port parameters

                       throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: UsbSerialPort_qcom
        Flush non-transmitted output data and / or non-read input data
        Specified by:
        purgeHwBuffers in interface UsbSerialPort_qcom
        Parameters:
        flushRX - true to flush non-transmitted output data
        flushTX - true to flush non-read input data
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, or false if the operation is not supported by the driver or device
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred during flush
